books.title: Things Fall Apart (1958)
books.author: Chinua Achebe
books.description: This is Achebe's most famous work, set in the late 19th century. It tells the story of Okonkwo, an Igbo man, and his struggle against colonialism and changing traditions. The novel explores themes of cultural clash, colonialism, and the personal consequences of societal change.

books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: A philosophical novel that delves into themes of faith, free will, and morality, centered around a family of three brothers.
